vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in TestMintableERC20Token.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.6.5']
	- TestMintableERC20Token.sol#21 declares pragma solidity^0.6.5
	- TestMintableERC20Token.sol#22 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in TestMintableERC20Token.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.6.5 (TestMintableERC20Token.sol#21): it allows old versions

errors: exception (RuntimeError: Source map error, unknown name(SHR) or instr_name(INVALID))

vulnerability_findings.name: Integer Arithmetic Bugs (SWC 101)
vulnerability_findings.message:
The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation. 
Classification: SWC-101
